#summary bluecove on Windows Mobile

= Introduction =

  Current !BlueCove Winsock code (Microsoft Bluetooth stack) compiled for Windows Mobile.

  Version 2.0.0 has been tested with following JVMs:

    * [http://www2s.biglobe.ne.jp/~dat/java/project/jvm/index_en.html Mysaifu JVM ] - An open-source (GPL v.2 license) Java VM
    * [http://www.ibm.com/software/wireless/weme/ IBMs WebSphere Everyplace Micro Environment] v5.7.2, CDC 1.0/Foundation 1.0/Personal Profile 1.0 for Windows XP/X86
    * [http://www.ibm.com/software/wireless/weme/ IBMs WebSphere Everyplace Micro Environment] v6.1.1, CDC 1.0/Foundation 1.0/Personal Profile 1.0 for Windows XP/X86
    * [http://www.ibm.com/software/wireless/weme/ IBMs WebSphere Everyplace Micro Environment] v5.7.2, CLDC 1.1, MIDP 2.0 for Windows XP/X86

== BlueCove Installation for IBM J9 on Windows Mobile ==

=== J9 for MIDP 2.0 Profile ===

    * Copy to `bluecove.jar` %J9_HOME%\lib\jclMidp20\ext directory
    * Copy intelbth_ce.dll or bluecove_ce.dll to %J9_HOME%\bin directory
    * run app "%J9_HOME%\bin\j9.exe" -jcl:midp20 -Dmicroedition.connection.pkgs=com.intel.bluetooth -cp YourMidpApp.jar "-jxe:%J9_HOME%\lib\jclMidp20\jclMidp20.jxe" YourMidpApp.jad

=== J9 for Personal Profile 1.0 ===

    * Add `bluecove.jar` to your classpath
    * Add system property `-Dmicroedition.connection.pkgs=com.intel.bluetooth` when running your application
